model.chip_description: Product Features • ARM Cortex-M3 CPU platform • High Performance 32-bit processor @ up to 32 MHz • Memory Protection Unit • Wake-up Interrupt Controller • Flexible Energy Management System • 20 nA @ 3 V Shutoff Mode • 0.6 μA @ 3 V Stop Mode, including Power-on Reset, Brown-out Detector, RAM and CPU retention • 0.9 μA @ 3 V Deep Sleep Mode, including Real Time Clock with 32.768 kHz oscillator, Power-on Reset, Brown-out Detector, RAM and CPU retention • 45 μA/MHz @ 3 V Sleep Mode • 180 μA/MHz @ 3 V Run Mode, with code executed from flash • 128/64/32 KB Flash • 16/16/8 KB RAM • 90 General Purpose I/O pins • Configurable Push-pull, Open-drain, pull-up/down, input filter, drive strength • Configurable peripheral I/O locations • 16 asynchronous external interrupts • 8 Channel DMA Controller • 8 Channel Peripheral Reflex System for autonomous inter-peripheral signaling • Hardware AES with 128/256-bit keys in 54/75 cycles • Timers/Counters • 3× 16-bit Timer/Counter • 3×3 Compare/Capture/PWM channels • Dead-Time Insertion on TIMER0 • 16-bit Low Energy Timer • 24-bit Real-Time Counter • 3× 8-bit Pulse Counter • Asynchronous pulse counting/quadrature decoding • Watchdog Timer with dedicated RC oscillator @ 50 nA • Integrated LCD Controller for up to 4×40 segments • Voltage boost, adjustable contrast adjustment and autonomous animation feature • External Bus Interface for up to 64 MB of external memory mapped space • Communication interfaces • 3× Universal Synchronous/Asynchronous Receiver/ Transmitter • UART/SPI/SmartCard (ISO 7816)/IrDA • Triple buffered full/half-duplex operation • 4-16 data bits • Universal Asynchronous Receiver/Transmitter • Triple buffered full/half-duplex operation • 8-9 data bits • 2× Low Energy UART • Autonomous operation with DMA in Deep Sleep Mode • I2C Interface with SMBus support • Address recognition in Stop Mode • Ultra low power precision analog peripherals • 12-bit 1 Msamples/s Analog to Digital Converter • 8 single ended channels/4 differential channels • On-chip temperature sensor • Conversion tailgating for predictable latency • 12-bit 500 ksamples/s Digital to Analog Converter • 2 single ended channels/1 differential channel • 2× Analog Comparator • Programmable speed/current • Capacitive sensing with up to 8 inputs • Supply Voltage Comparator • Ultra efficient Power-on Reset and Brown-Out Detector • 2-pin Serial Wire Debug interface • 1-pin Serial Wire Viewer • Pre-Programmed Serial Bootloader • Temperature range -40 to 85 ºC • Single power supply 1.8 to 3.8 V • BGA112/QFN32/QFN64/QFP100 packages Copyright © 2011 Energy Micro AS. All rights reserved.

field.name: MODE
field.description: Read Mode - Value, Description 0x00, WS0 - Zero wait-states inserted in fetch or read transfers 0x01, WS1 - One wait-state inserted for each fetch or read transfer. This mode is required for a core frequency above 16 MHz. 0x02, WS0SCBTP - Zero wait-states inserted with the Suppressed Conditional Branch Target Prefetch (SCBTP) function enabled. SCBTP saves energy by delaying Cortex-M3 conditional branch target prefetches until the conditional branch instruction is in the execute stage. When the instruction reaches this stage, the evaluation of the branch condition is completed and the core does not perform a speculative prefetch of both the branch target address and the next sequential address. With the SCBTP function enabled, one instruction fetch is saved for each branch not taken, with a negligible performance penalty. 0x03, WS1SCBTP - One wait-state access with SCBTP enabled. 0x04, WS2 - Two wait-states inserted for eatch fetch or read transfer. This mode is required for a core frequency above 32 MHz 0x05, WS2SCBTP - Two wait-state access with SCBTP enabled.

field.description: RAM block power-down - Value, Description 0x04, BLK3 - Power down RAM block 3 (address range 0x20018000-0x2001FFFF) 0x06, BLK23 - Power down RAM blocks 2-3 (address range 0x20010000-0x2001FFFF) 0x07, BLK123 - Power down RAM blocks 1-3 (address range 0x20008000-0x2001FFFF)

field.name: LOCKKEY

field.name: OSC
field.description: Select EM4 duty oscillator - Value, Description 0x00, ULFRCO - ULFRCO is available 0x01, LFRCO - LFRCO is available. Can only be set if LFRCO is running before EM4/backup entry 0x02, LFXO - LFXO is available. Can only be set if LFXO is available before EM4/backup entry

field.name: PROBE
field.description: Voltage probe select - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - Disable voltage probe 0x01, VDDDREG - Connect probe to VDD_DREG 0x02, BUIN - Connect probe to BU_IN 0x03, BUOUT - Connect probe to BU_OUT

field.name: PWRRES
field.description: Power domain resistor select - Value, Description 0x00, RES0 - Main power and backup power connected with RES0 series resistance. 0x01, RES1 - Main power and backup power connected with RES1 series resistance. 0x02, RES2 - Main power and backup power connected with RES2 series resistance. 0x03, RES3 - Main power and backup power connected with RES3 series resistance.

field.name: PWRCON
field.description: Power connection configuration when not in Backup mode - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - No connection. 0x01, BUMAIN - Main power and backup power are connected through a diode, allowing current to flow from backup power source to main power source, but not the other way. 0x02, MAINBU - Main power and backup power are connected through a diode, allowing current to flow from main power source to backup power source, but not the other way. 0x03, NODIODE - Main power and backup power are connected without diode.

field.name: PWRCON
field.description: Power connection configuration when in Backup mode. - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - No connection. 0x01, BUMAIN - Main power and backup power are connected through a diode, allowing current to flow from backup power source to main power source, but not the other way. 0x02, MAINBU - Main power and backup power are connected through a diode, allowing current to flow from main power source to backup power source, but not the other way. 0x03, NODIODE - Main power and backup power are connected without diode.

field.name: BURDY
field.description: Set Backup functionality ready Interrupt Flag

field.name: BURDY
field.description: Clear Backup functionality ready Interrupt Flag

field.name: BODUNREGRST
field.description: Brown Out Detector Unregulated Domain Reset

field.name: BODREGRST
field.description: Brown Out Detector Regulated Domain Reset

field.name: BUBODUNREG
field.description: Backup Brown Out Detector Unregulated Domain

field.name: BUBODREG
field.description: Backup Brown Out Detector Regulated Domain

field.name: HFXOMODE
field.description: HFXO Mode - Value, Description 0x00, XTAL - 4-32 MHz crystal oscillator 0x01, BUFEXTCLK - An AC coupled buffer is coupled in series with HFXTAL_N, suitable for external sine wave (4-32 MHz). The sine wave should have a minimum of 200mV peak to peak. 0x02, DIGEXTCLK - Digital external clock on HFXTAL_N pin. Oscillator is effectively bypassed.

field.name: HFXOBOOST
field.description: HFXO Start-up Boost Current - Value, Description 0x00, 50PCENT - 50 % 0x01, 70PCENT - 70 % 0x02, 80PCENT - 80 % 0x03, 100PCENT - 100 % (default)

field.name: HFXOTIMEOUT
field.description: HFXO Timeout - Value, Description 0x00, 8CYCLES - Timeout period of 8 cycles 0x01, 256CYCLES - Timeout period of 256 cycles 0x02, 1KCYCLES - Timeout period of 1024 cycles 0x03, 16KCYCLES - Timeout period of 16384 cycles

field.name: LFXOMODE
field.description: LFXO Mode - Value, Description 0x00, XTAL - 32.768 kHz crystal oscillator 0x01, BUFEXTCLK - An AC coupled buffer is coupled in series with LFXTAL_N pin, suitable for external sinus wave (32.768 kHz). 0x02, DIGEXTCLK - Digital external clock on LFXTAL_N pin. Oscillator is effectively bypassed.

field.name: LFXOTIMEOUT
field.description: LFXO Timeout - Value, Description 0x00, 8CYCLES - Timeout period of 8 cycles 0x01, 1KCYCLES - Timeout period of 1024 cycles 0x02, 16KCYCLES - Timeout period of 16384 cycles 0x03, 32KCYCLES - Timeout period of 32768 cycles

field.name: CLKOUTSEL0
field.description: Clock Output Select 0 - Value, Description 0x00, HFRCO - HFRCO (directly from oscillator) 0x01, HFXO - HFXO (directly from oscillator) 0x02, HFCLK2 - HFCLK/2 0x03, HFCLK4 - HFCLK/4 0x04, HFCLK8 - HFCLK/8 0x05, HFCLK16 - HFCLK/16 0x06, ULFRCO - ULFRCO (directly from oscillator) 0x07, AUXHFRCO - AUXHFRCO (directly from oscillator)

field.name: CLKOUTSEL1
field.description: Clock Output Select 1 - Value, Description 0x00, LFRCO - LFRCO (directly from oscillator) 0x01, LFXO - LFXO (directly from oscillator) 0x02, HFCLK - HFCLK 0x03, LFXOQ - LFXO (qualified) 0x04, HFXOQ - HFXO (qualified) 0x05, LFRCOQ - LFRCO (qualified) 0x06, HFRCOQ - HFRCO (qualified) 0x07, AUXHFRCOQ - AUXHFRCO (qualified)

NOTE: Also set the TUNING value (bits 7:0) when changing band. 0x02, 11MHZ - 11 MHz. NOTE: Also set the TUNING value (bits 7:0) when changing band. 0x03, 14MHZ - 14 MHz. field.description: I/O Location - Value, Description 0x00, LOC0 - Location 0 0x01, LOC1 - Location 1 0x02, LOC2 - Location 2

field.name: LOCKKEY

field.description: Configure byte order in data and key registers

field.name: SCANMODE
field.description: Configure scan mode - Value, Description 0x00, PERIODIC - A new scan is started each time the period counter overflows 0x01, ONESHOT - A single scan is performed when START in CMD is set 0x02, PRS - Pulse on PRS channel

field.name: PRSSEL
field.description: Scan start PRS select - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected as input 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected as input 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected as input 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected as input 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected as input 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected as input 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected as input 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected as input 0x08, PRSCH8 - PRS Channel 8 selected as input 0x09, PRSCH9 - PRS Channel 9 selected as input 0x0A, PRSCH10 - PRS Channel 10 selected as input 0x0B, PRSCH11 - PRS Channel 11 selected as input

field.name: SCANCONF
field.description: Select scan configuration - Value, Description 0x00, DIRMAP - The channel configuration register registers used are directly mapped to the channel number. 0x01, INVMAP - The channel configuration register registers used are CHX+8_CONF for channels 0-7 and CHX-8_CONF for channels 8-15. 0x02, TOGGLE - The channel configuration register registers used toggles between CHX_CONF and CHX+8_CONF when channel x triggers 0x03, DECDEF - The decoder state defines the CONF registers to be used.

field.name: BUFIDL
field.description: Result buffer interrupt and DMA trigger level

field.name: DMAWU
field.description: DMA wakeup from EM2 - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - No DMA wakeup from EM2 0x01, BUFDATAV - DMA wakeup from EM2 when data is valid in the result buffer 0x02, BUFLEVEL - DMA wakeup from EM2 when the result buffer is full/halffull depending on BUFIDL configuration

field.name: AUXPRESC
field.description: Prescaling factor for high frequency timer - Value, Description 0x00, DIV1 - High frequency timer is clocked with AUXHFRCO/1 0x01, DIV2 - High frequency timer is clocked with AUXHFRCO/2 0x02, DIV4 - High frequency timer is clocked with AUXHFRCO/4 0x03, DIV8 - High frequency timer is clocked with AUXHFRCO/8

field.name: LFPRESC
field.description: Prescaling factor for low frequency timer - Value, Description 0x00, DIV1 - Low frequency timer is clocked with LFACLKLESENSE/1 0x01, DIV2 - Low frequency timer is clocked with LFACLKLESENSE/2 0x02, DIV4 - Low frequency timer is clocked with LFACLKLESENSE/4 0x03, DIV8 - Low frequency timer is clocked with LFACLKLESENSE/8 0x04, DIV16 - Low frequency timer is clocked with LFACLKLESENSE/16 0x05, DIV32 - Low frequency timer is clocked with LFACLKLESENSE/32 0x06, DIV64 - Low frequency timer is clocked with LFACLKLESENSE/64 0x07, DIV128 - Low frequency timer is clocked with LFACLKLESENSE/128

field.name: PCPRESC
field.description: Period counter prescaling - Value, Description 0x00, DIV1 - The period counter clock frequency is LFACLKLESENSE/1 0x01, DIV2 - The period counter clock frequency is LFACLKLESENSE/2 0x02, DIV4 - The period counter clock frequency is LFACLKLESENSE/4 0x03, DIV8 - The period counter clock frequency is LFACLKLESENSE/8 0x04, DIV16 - The period counter clock frequency is LFACLKLESENSE/16 0x05, DIV32 - The period counter clock frequency is LFACLKLESENSE/32 0x06, DIV64 - The period counter clock frequency is LFACLKLESENSE/64 0x07, DIV128 - The period counter clock frequency is LFACLKLESENSE/128

field.name: DACCH0CONV
field.description: DAC channel 0 conversion mode - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - LESENSE does not control DAC CH0. 0x01, CONTINUOUS - DAC channel 0 is driven in continuous mode. 0x02, SAMPLEHOLD - DAC channel 0 is driven in sample hold mode. 0x03, SAMPLEOFF - DAC channel 0 is driven in sample off mode.

field.name: DACCH1CONV
field.description: DAC channel 1 conversion mode - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - LESENSE does not control DAC CH1. 0x01, CONTINUOUS - DAC channel 1 is driven in continuous mode. 0x02, SAMPLEHOLD - DAC channel 1 is driven in sample hold mode. 0x03, SAMPLEOFF - DAC channel 1 is driven in sample off mode.

field.name: DACCH0OUT
field.description: DAC channel 0 output mode - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - DAC CH0 output to pin and ACMP/ADC disabled 0x01, PIN - DAC CH0 output to pin enabled, output to ADC and ACMP disabled 0x02, ADCACMP - DAC CH0 output to pin disabled, output to ADC and ACMP enabled 0x03, PINADCACMP - DAC CH0 output to pin, ADC, and ACMP enabled.

field.name: DACCH1OUT
field.description: DAC channel 1 output mode - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - DAC CH1 output to pin and ACMP/ADC disabled 0x01, PIN - DAC CH1 output to pin enabled, output to ADC and ACMP disabled 0x02, ADCACMP - DAC CH1 output to pin disabled, output to ADC and ACMP enabled 0x03, PINADCACMP - DAC CH1 output to pin, ADC, and ACMP enabled.

field.name: ACMP0MODE
field.description: ACMP0 mode - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - LESENSE does not control ACMP0 0x01, MUX - LESENSE controls the input mux (POSSEL) of ACMP0 0x02, MUXTHRES - LESENSE controls the input mux (POSSEL) and the threshold value (VDDLEVEL) of ACMP0

field.name: ACMP1MODE
field.description: ACMP1 mode - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - LESENSE does not control ACMP1 0x01, MUX - LESENSE controls the input mux (POSSEL) of ACMP1 0x02, MUXTHRES - LESENSE controls the input mux and the threshold value (VDDLEVEL) of ACMP1

field.name: WARMUPMODE
field.description: ACMP and DAC duty cycle mode - Value, Description 0x00, NORMAL - The analog comparators and DAC are shut down when LESENSE is idle 0x01, KEEPACMPWARM - The analog comparators are kept powered up when LESENSE is idle 0x02, KEEPDACWARM - The DAC is kept powered up when LESENSE is idle 0x03, KEEPACMPDACWARM - The analog comparators and DAC are kept powered up when LESENSE is idle

field.name: INTMAP
field.description: Enable decoder to channel interrupt mapping

field.name: HYSTPRS0
field.description: Enable decoder hysteresis on PRS0 output

field.name: HYSTPRS1
field.description: Enable decoder hysteresis on PRS1 output

field.name: HYSTPRS2
field.description: Enable decoder hysteresis on PRS2 output

field.name: HYSTIRQ
field.description: Enable decoder hysteresis on interrupt requests

field.name: PRSCNT
field.description: Enable count mode on decoder PRS channels 0 and 1

field.name: PRSSEL0

field.name: SETIF
field.description: Enable interrupt generation - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - No interrupt is generated 0x01, LEVEL - Set interrupt flag if the sensor triggers. 0x02, POSEDGE - Set interrupt flag on positive edge on the sensor state 0x03, NEGEDGE - Set interrupt flag on negative edge on the sensor state

field.name: EXMODE
field.description: Set GPIO mode - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - Disabled 0x01, HIGH - Push Pull, GPIO is driven high 0x02, LOW - Push Pull, GPIO is driven low 0x03, DACOUT - DAC output

field.name: MODE
field.description: Mode - Value, Description 0x00, D8A8 - EBI_AD drives 8 bit data, 8 bit address, ALE not used. Extended address bits can be enabled on EBI_A in the EBI_ROUTE register. 0x01, D16A16ALE - EBI_AD drives 16 bit data, 16 bit address, ALE is used for address latching. Extended address bits can be enabled on EBI_A in the EBI_ROUTE register. 0x02, D8A24ALE - EBI_AD drives 8 bit data, 24 bit address, ALE is used for address latching. Extended address bits can be enabled on EBI_A in the EBI_ROUTE register. 0x03, D16 - EBI_AD drives 16 bit data, ALE not used. Extended address bits can be enabled on EBI_A in the EBI_ROUTE register.

field.name: MODE1
field.description: Mode 1 - Value, Description 0x00, D8A8 - EBI_AD drives 8 bit data, 8 bit address, ALE not used. Extended address bits can be enabled on EBI_A in the EBI_ROUTE register. 0x01, D16A16ALE - EBI_AD drives 16 bit data, 16 bit address, ALE is used for address latching. Extended address bits can be enabled on EBI_A in the EBI_ROUTE register. 0x02, D8A24ALE - EBI_AD drives 8 bit data, 24 bit address, ALE is used for address latching. Extended address bits can be enabled on EBI_A in the EBI_ROUTE register. 0x03, D16 - EBI_AD drives 16 bit data, ALE not used. Extended address bits can be enabled on EBI_A in the EBI_ROUTE register.

field.name: MODE2
field.description: Mode 2 - Value, Description 0x00, D8A8 - EBI_AD drives 8 bit data, 8 bit address, ALE not used. Extended address bits can be enabled on EBI_A in the EBI_ROUTE register. 0x01, D16A16ALE - EBI_AD drives 16 bit data, 16 bit address, ALE is used for address latching. Extended address bits can be enabled on EBI_A in the EBI_ROUTE register. 0x02, D8A24ALE - EBI_AD drives 8 bit data, 24 bit address, ALE is used for address latching. Extended address bits can be enabled on EBI_A in the EBI_ROUTE register. 0x03, D16 - EBI_AD drives 16 bit data, ALE not used. Extended address bits can be enabled on EBI_A in the EBI_ROUTE register.

field.name: MODE3
field.description: Mode 3 - Value, Description 0x00, D8A8 - EBI_AD drives 8 bit data, 8 bit address, ALE not used. Extended address bits can be enabled on EBI_A in the EBI_ROUTE register. 0x01, D16A16ALE - EBI_AD drives 16 bit data, 16 bit address, ALE is used for address latching. Extended address bits can be enabled on EBI_A in the EBI_ROUTE register. 0x02, D8A24ALE - EBI_AD drives 8 bit data, 24 bit address, ALE is used for address latching. Extended address bits can be enabled on EBI_A in the EBI_ROUTE register. 0x03, D16 - EBI_AD drives 16 bit data, ALE not used. Extended address bits can be enabled on EBI_A in the EBI_ROUTE register.

field.name: NOIDLE
field.description: No idle cycle insertion on bank 0.

field.name: NOIDLE1
field.description: No idle cycle insertion on bank 1.

field.name: NOIDLE2
field.description: No idle cycle insertion on bank 2.

field.name: NOIDLE3
field.description: No idle cycle insertion on bank 3.

field.name: ITS
field.description: Individual Timing Set, Line Polarity and Mode Definition Enable

field.name: HALFALE
field.description: Half Cycle ALE Stobe Duration Enable

field.name: HALFRE
field.description: Half Cycle REn Stobe Duration Enable

field.name: HALFWE
field.description: Half Cycle WEn Stobe Duration Enable

field.name: ALB
field.description: Sets the lower bound for EBI_A enabling - Value, Description 0x00, A0 - Address lines from EBI_A[0] and upwards can be enabled via APEN. 0x01, A8 - Address lines from EBI_A[8] and upwards can be enabled via APEN. 0x02, A16 - Address lines from EBI_A[16] and upwards can be enabled via APEN. 0x03, A24 - Address lines from EBI_A[24] and upwards can be enabled via APEN.

field.name: APEN
field.description: EBI_A Pin Enable - Value, Description 0x00, A0 - All EBI_A pins are disabled. 0x05, A5 - EBI_A[4:L] pins enabled. 0x06, A6 - EBI_A[5:L] pins enabled. 0x07, A7 - EBI_A[6:L] pins enabled. 0x08, A8 - EBI_A[7:L] pins enabled. 0x09, A9 - EBI_A[8:L] pins enabled. 0x0A, A10 - EBI_A[9:L] pins enabled. 0x0B, A11 - EBI_A[10:L] pins enabled. 0x0C, A12 - EBI_A[11:L] pins enabled. 0x0D, A13 - EBI_A[12:L] pins enabled. 0x0E, A14 - EBI_A[13:L] pins enabled. 0x0F, A15 - EBI_A[14:L] pins enabled. 0x010, A16 - EBI_A[15:L] pins enabled. 0x011, A17 - EBI_A[16:L] pins enabled. 0x012, A18 - EBI_A[17:L] pins enabled. 0x013, A19 - EBI_A[18:L] pins enabled. 0x014, A20 - EBI_A[19:L] pins enabled. 0x015, A21 - EBI_A[20:L] pins enabled. 0x016, A22 - EBI_A[21:L] pins enabled. 0x017, A23 - EBI_A[22:L] pins enabled. 0x018, A24 - EBI_A[23:L] pins enabled. 0x019, A25 - EBI_A[24:L] pins enabled. 0x01A, A26 - EBI_A[25:L] pins enabled. 0x01B, A27 - EBI_A[26:L] pins enabled. 0x01C, A28 - EBI_A[27:L] pins enabled.

field.name: LOCATION
field.description: I/O Location - Value, Description 0x00, LOC0 - Location 0 0x01, LOC1 - Location 1 0x02, LOC2 - Location 2

field.name: HALFALE
field.description: Half Cycle ALE Stobe Duration Enable

field.name: HALFRE
field.description: Half Cycle REn Stobe Duration Enable

field.name: HALFWE
field.description: Half Cycle WEn Stobe Duration Enable

field.name: HALFALE
field.description: Half Cycle ALE Stobe Duration Enable

field.name: HALFRE
field.description: Half Cycle REn Stobe Duration Enable

field.name: HALFWE
field.description: Half Cycle WEn Stobe Duration Enable

field.name: HALFALE
field.description: Half Cycle ALE Stobe Duration Enable

field.name: HALFRE
field.description: Half Cycle REn Stobe Duration Enable

field.name: HALFWE
field.description: Half Cycle WEn Stobe Duration Enable

field.name: PAGELEN
field.description: Page Length - Value, Description 0x00, MEMBER4 - 4 members in a page. 0x01, MEMBER8 - 8 members in a page. 0x02, MEMBER16 - 16 members in a page. 0x03, MEMBER32 - 32 members in a page.

field.name: INCHIT
field.description: Intrapage hit only on incremental addresses

field.name: BANKSEL
field.description: NAND Flash Bank - Value, Description 0x00, BANK0 - Memory bank 0 is connected to a NAND Flash device. 0x01, BANK1 - Memory bank 1 is connected to a NAND Flash device. 0x02, BANK2 - Memory bank 2 is connected to a NAND Flash device. 0x03, BANK3 - Memory bank 3 is connected to a NAND Flash device.

field.name: DDACT
field.description: EBI Busy with Direct Drive Transactions.

field.name: DD
field.description: TFT Direct Drive Mode - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLED - Direct Drive is disabled. 0x01, INTERNAL - Direct Drive from internal memory enabled and started. 0x02, EXTERNAL - Direct Drive from external memory enabled and started.

field.name: MASKBLEND
field.description: TFT Mask and Blend Mode - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLED - Masking and Blending are disabled. 0x01, IMASK - Internal Masking is enabled. 0x02, IALPHA - Internal Alpha Blending is enabled. 0x03, IMASKIALPHA - Internal Masking and Alpha Blending are enabled. 0x05, EMASK - External Masking is enabled. 0x06, EALPHA - External Alpha Blending is enabled. 0x07, EMASKEALPHA - External Masking and Alpha Blending are enabled.

field.name: INTERLEAVE
field.description: Interleave Mode - Value, Description 0x00, UNLIMITED - Allow unlimited interleaved EBI accesses per EBI_DCLK period. This can cause jitter on the EBI_DCLK 0x01, ONEPERDCLK - Allow 1 interleaved EBI access per EBI_DCLK period. 0x02, PORCH - Only allow EBI accesses during TFT porches.

field.name: BANKSEL
field.description: Graphics Bank - Value, Description 0x00, BANK0 - Memory bank 0 is used for Direct Drive, Masking, and Alpha Blending. 0x01, BANK1 - Memory bank 1 is used for Direct Drive, Masking, and Alpha Blending. 0x02, BANK2 - Memory bank 2 is used for Direct Drive, Masking, and Alpha Blending. 0x03, BANK3 - Memory bank 3 is used for Direct Drive, Masking, and Alpha Blending.

field.name: DATA
field.description: TFT Direct Drive Data from Internal Memory

register.name: TFTPIXEL
register.description: TFT Alpha Blending Result Pixel Register

field.name: DDEMPTY
field.description: Direct Drive Data Empty Interrupt Flag

field.name: VBPORCH
field.description: Vertical Back Porch Interrupt Flag Set

field.name: VFPORCH

field.name: DRIVEMODE
field.description: Drive Mode Select - Value, Description 0x00, STANDARD - 6 mA drive current 0x01, LOWEST - 0.5 mA drive current 0x02, HIGH - 20 mA drive current 0x03, LOW - 2 mA drive current

field.name: MODE0
field.description: Pin 0 Mode - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLED - Input disabled. Pullup if DOUT is set. 0x01, INPUT - Input enabled. Filter if DOUT is set 0x02, INPUTPULL - Input enabled. DOUT determines pull direction 0x03, INPUTPULLFILTER - Input enabled with filter. field.name: MODE
field.description: Timer Mode - Value, Description 0x00, UP - Up-count mode 0x01, DOWN - Down-count mode 0x02, UPDOWN - Up/down-count mode 0x03, QDEC - Quadrature decoder mode

field.name: RISEA
field.description: Timer Rising Input Edge Action - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - No action 0x01, START - Start counter without reload 0x02, STOP - Stop counter without reload 0x03, RELOADSTART - Reload and start counter

field.name: FALLA
field.description: Timer Falling Input Edge Action - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - No action 0x01, START - Start counter without reload 0x02, STOP - Stop counter without reload 0x03, RELOADSTART - Reload and start counter

field.name: CLKSEL
field.description: Clock Source Select - Value, Description 0x00, PRESCHFPERCLK - Prescaled HFPERCLK 0x01, CC1 - Compare/Capture Channel 1 Input 0x02, TIMEROUF - Timer is clocked by underflow(down-count) or overflow(up-count) in the lower numbered neighbor Timer

field.name: PRESC
field.description: Prescaler Setting - Value, Description 0x00, DIV1 - The HFPERCLK is undivided 0x01, DIV2 - The HFPERCLK is divided by 2 0x02, DIV4 - The HFPERCLK is divided by 4 0x03, DIV8 - The HFPERCLK is divided by 8 0x04, DIV16 - The HFPERCLK is divided by 16 0x05, DIV32 - The HFPERCLK is divided by 32 0x06, DIV64 - The HFPERCLK is divided by 64 0x07, DIV128 - The HFPERCLK is divided by 128 0x08, DIV256 - The HFPERCLK is divided by 256 0x09, DIV512 - The HFPERCLK is divided by 512 0x0A, DIV1024 - The HFPERCLK is divided by 1024

field.description: Reload-Start Sets Compare Ouptut initial State

field.name: CMOA
field.description: Compare Match Output Action - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - No action on compare match 0x01, TOGGLE - Toggle output on compare match 0x02, CLEAR - Clear output on compare match 0x03, SET - Set output on compare match

field.description: Action On Slave-Select In Master Mode

field.name: TXDELAY
field.description: TX Delay Transmission - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - Frames are transmitted immediately 0x01, SINGLE - Transmission of new frames are delayed by a single baud period 0x02, DOUBLE - Transmission of new frames are delayed by two baud periods 0x03, TRIPLE - Transmission of new frames are delayed by three baud periods

field.name: AUTOTX
field.description: Always Transmit When RX Not Full

field.name: DATABITS
field.description: Data-Bit Mode - Value, Description 0x01, FOUR - Each frame contains 4 data bits 0x02, FIVE - Each frame contains 5 data bits 0x03, SIX - Each frame contains 6 data bits 0x04, SEVEN - Each frame contains 7 data bits 0x05, EIGHT - Each frame contains 8 data bits 0x06, NINE - Each frame contains 9 data bits 0x07, TEN - Each frame contains 10 data bits 0x08, ELEVEN - Each frame contains 11 data bits 0x09, TWELVE - Each frame contains 12 data bits 0x0A, THIRTEEN - Each frame contains 13 data bits 0x0B, FOURTEEN - Each frame contains 14 data bits 0x0C, FIFTEEN - Each frame contains 15 data bits 0x0D, SIXTEEN - Each frame contains 16 data bits

field.name: PARITY
field.description: Parity-Bit Mode - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - Parity bits are not used 0x02, EVEN - Even parity are used. Parity bits are automatically generated and checked by hardware. 0x03, ODD - Odd parity is used. Parity bits are automatically generated and checked by hardware.

field.name: STOPBITS
field.description: Stop-Bit Mode - Value, Description 0x00, HALF - The transmitter generates a half stop bit. Stop-bits are not verified by receiver 0x01, ONE - One stop bit is generated and verified 0x02, ONEANDAHALF - The transmitter generates one and a half stop bit. The receiver verifies the first stop bit 0x03, TWO - The transmitter generates two stop bits. The receiver checks the first stop-bit only

field.description: RX PRS Channel Select - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected 0x08, PRSCH8 - PRS Channel 8 selected 0x09, PRSCH9 - PRS Channel 9 selected 0x0A, PRSCH10 - PRS Channel 10 selected 0x0B, PRSCH11 - PRS Channel 11 selected

field.name: REPMODE
field.description: Repeat Mode - Value, Description 0x00, FREE - When started, the LETIMER counts down until it is stopped by software. 0x01, ONESHOT - The counter counts REP0 times. When REP0 reaches zero, the counter stops. 0x02, BUFFERED - The counter counts REP0 times. If REP1 has been written, it is loaded into REP0 when REP0 reaches zero. Else the counter stops 0x03, DOUBLE - Both REP0 and REP1 are decremented when the LETIMER wraps around. The LETIMER counts until both REP0 and REP1 are zero

field.name: UFOA0
field.description: Underflow Output Action 0 - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - LETn_O0 is held at its idle value as defined by OPOL0. 0x01, TOGGLE - LETn_O0 is toggled on CNT underflow. 0x02, PULSE - LETn_O0 is held active for one LFACLKLETIMER0 clock cycle on CNT underflow. The output then returns to its idle value as defined by OPOL0. 0x03, PWM - LETn_O0 is set idle on CNT underflow, and active on compare match with COMP1

field.name: UFOA1
field.description: Underflow Output Action 1 - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - LETn_O1 is held at its idle value as defined by OPOL1. 0x01, TOGGLE - LETn_O1 is toggled on CNT underflow. 0x02, PULSE - LETn_O1 is held active for one LFACLKLETIMER0 clock cycle on CNT underflow. The output then returns to its idle value as defined by OPOL1. 0x03, PWM - LETn_O1 is set idle on CNT underflow, and active on compare match with COMP1

field.name: LOCATION
field.description: I/O Location - Value, Description 0x00, LOC0 - Location 0 0x01, LOC1 - Location 1 0x02, LOC2 - Location 2 0x03, LOC3 - Location 3

field.name: MODE
field.description: Mode Select - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - The module is disabled 0x01, OVSSINGLE - Single input LFACLK oversampling mode (available in EM0-EM2) 0x02, EXTCLKSINGLE - Externally clocked single input counter mode (available in EM0-EM3) 0x03, EXTCLKQUAD - Externally clocked quadrature decoder mode (available in EM0-EM3)

field.name: CNTEV
field.description: Controls when the counter counts - Value, Description 0x00, BOTH - Counts up on up-count and down on down-count events 0x01, UP - Only counts up on up-count events 0x02, DOWN - Only counts down on down-count events 0x03, NONE - Never counts

field.name: AUXCNTEV
field.description: Controls when the auxillary counter counts - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - Never counts 0x01, UP - Counts up on up-count events 0x02, DOWN - Counts up on down-count events 0x03, BOTH - Counts up on both up-count and down-count events

field.name: LOCATION
field.description: I/O Location - Value, Description 0x00, LOC0 - Location 0 0x01, LOC1 - Location 1 0x02, LOC2 - Location 2 0x03, LOC3 - Location 3

field.name: S0PRSSEL

field.name: CLHR
field.description: Clock Low High Ratio - Value, Description 0x00, STANDARD - The ratio is 4:4. Both low and high periods lasts 4 prescaled clock cycles 0x01, ASYMMETRIC - The ratio is 6:3. Low period lasts 6 and high period lasts 4 prescaled clock cycles 0x02, FAST - The ratio is 14:9. Low period lasts 16 and high period lasts 9 prescaled clock cycles

field.name: BITO
field.description: Bus Idle Timeout - Value, Description 0x00, OFF - Timeout disabled 0x01, 40PCC - Timeout after 40 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 50us timeout. 0x02, 80PCC - Timeout after 80 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 100us timeout. 0x03, 160PCC - Timeout after 160 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 200us timeout.

field.name: CLTO

In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 400us timeout. 0x05, 1024PPC - Timeout after 1024 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 1280us timeout.

field.description: OPA1 Output Enable Value - Value, Description 0x01, OUT0 - Alternate Output 0 0x02, OUT1 - Alternate Output 1 0x04, OUT2 - Alternate Output 2 0x08, OUT3 - Alternate Output 3 0x010, OUT4 - Alternate Output 4

field.description: Output Select - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - OPA0 output is disabled 0x01, MAIN - Main OPA1 output to pin enabled 0x02, ALT - OPA1 alternative output enabled. 0x03, ALL - Main OPA1 output drives both main and alternative outputs.

field.name: RESSEL
field.description: OPA1 Resistor Ladder Select - Value, Description 0x00, RES0 - Gain of 1/3 0x01, RES1 - Gain of 1 0x02, RES2 - Gain of 1 2/3 0x03, RES3 - Gain of 2 0x04, RES4 - Gain of 3 0x05, RES5 - Gain of 4 1/3 0x06, RES6 - Gain of 7 0x07, RES7 - Gain of 15

field.name: POSSEL
field.description: OPA2 non-inverting Input Mux - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - Input disabled 0x02, POSPAD - POS PAD as input 0x03, OPA1INP - OPA1 as input 0x04, OPATAP - OPA0 Resistor ladder as input

field.name: NEGSEL
field.description: OPA2 inverting Input Mux - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - Input disabled 0x01, UG - Unity Gain feedback path 0x02, OPATAP - OPA2 Resistor ladder as input 0x03, NEGPAD - Input from NEG PAD

field.name: RESINMUX
field.description: OPA2 Resistor Ladder Input Mux - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - Set for Unity Gain 0x01, OPA1INP - Set for OPA1 input 0x02, NEGPAD - NEG PAD connected 0x03, POSPAD - POS PAD connected 0x04, VSS - VSS connected

field.name: OUTPEN
field.description: OPA2 Output Location - Value, Description 0x01, OUT0 - Main Output 0 0x02, OUT1 - Main Output 1

field.name: RESSEL
field.description: OPA2 Resistor Ladder Select - Value, Description 0x00, RES0 - Gain of 1/3 0x01, RES1 - Gain of 1 0x02, RES2 - Gain of 1 2/3 0x03, RES3 - Gain of 2 0x04, RES4 - Gain of 3 0x05, RES5 - Gain of 4 1/3 0x06, RES6 - Gain of 7 0x07, RES7 - Gain of 15

field.name: HYSTSEL
field.description: Hysteresis Select - Value, Description 0x00, HYST0 - No hysteresis 0x01, HYST1 - ~15 mV hysteresis 0x02, HYST2 - ~22 mV hysteresis 0x03, HYST3 - ~29 mV hysteresis 0x04, HYST4 - ~36 mV hysteresis 0x05, HYST5 - ~43 mV hysteresis 0x06, HYST6 - ~50 mV hysteresis 0x07, HYST7 - ~57 mV hysteresis

field.name: WARMTIME
field.description: Warm-up Time - Value, Description 0x00, 4CYCLES - 4 HFPERCLK cycles 0x01, 8CYCLES - 8 HFPERCLK cycles 0x02, 16CYCLES - 16 HFPERCLK cycles 0x03, 32CYCLES - 32 HFPERCLK cycles 0x04, 64CYCLES - 64 HFPERCLK cycles 0x05, 128CYCLES - 128 HFPERCLK cycles 0x06, 256CYCLES - 256 HFPERCLK cycles 0x07, 512CYCLES - 512 HFPERCLK cycles

field.name: POSSEL
field.description: Positive Input Select - Value, Description 0x00, CH0 - Channel 0 as positive input 0x01, CH1 - Channel 1 as positive input 0x02, CH2 - Channel 2 as positive input 0x03, CH3 - Channel 3 as positive input 0x04, CH4 - Channel 4 as positive input 0x05, CH5 - Channel 5 as positive input 0x06, CH6 - Channel 6 as positive input 0x07, CH7 - Channel 7 as positive input

field.name: NEGSEL
field.description: Negative Input Select - Value, Description 0x00, CH0 - Channel 0 as negative input 0x01, CH1 - Channel 1 as negative input 0x02, CH2 - Channel 2 as negative input 0x03, CH3 - Channel 3 as negative input 0x04, CH4 - Channel 4 as negative input 0x05, CH5 - Channel 5 as negative input 0x06, CH6 - Channel 6 as negative input 0x07, CH7 - Channel 7 as negative input 0x08, 1V25 - 1.25 V as negative input 0x09, 2V5 - 2.5 V as negative input 0x0A, VDD - Scaled VDD as negative input 0x0B, CAPSENSE - Capacitive sense mode 0x0C, DAC0CH0 - DAC0 channel 0 0x0D, DAC0CH1 - DAC0 channel 1

field.name: CSRESEN
field.description: Capacitive Sense Mode Internal Resistor Enable

field.name: CSRESSEL
field.description: Capacitive Sense Mode Internal Resistor Select - Value, Description 0x00, RES0 - Internal capacitive sense resistor value 0 0x01, RES1 - Internal capacitive sense resistor value 1 0x02, RES2 - Internal capacitive sense resistor value 2 0x03, RES3 - Internal capacitive sense resistor value 3

field.name: HBSTLEN
field.description: Burst Length/Type (host and device) - Value, Description 0x00, SINGLE - Single transfer. 0x01, INCR - Incrementing burst of unspecified length. 0x03, INCR4 - 4-beat incrementing burst. 0x05, INCR8 - 8-beat incrementing burst. 0x07, INCR16 - 16-beat incrementing burst.

field.name: NPTXFEMPLVL
field.description: Non-Periodic TxFIFO Empty Level (host and device)

field.name: FSINTF
field.description: Full-Speed Serial Interface Select (host and device)

field.name: TXFNUM
field.description: TxFIFO Number (host and device) - Value, Description 0x00, F0 - Host mode: Non-periodic TxFIFO flush. Device: Tx FIFO 0 flush 0x01, F1 - Host mode: Periodic TxFIFO flush. Device: TXFIFO 1 flush. 0x02, F2 - Device mode: TXFIFO 2 flush. 0x03, F3 - Device mode: TXFIFO 3 flush. 0x04, F4 - Device mode: TXFIFO 4 flush. 0x05, F5 - Device mode: TXFIFO 5 flush. 0x06, F6 - Device mode: TXFIFO 6 flush. 0x010, FALL - Flush all the transmit FIFOs in device or host mode.

field.description: Data PID (host or device) - Value, Description 0x00, DATA0 - DATA0 PID. 0x01, DATA1 - DATA1 PID. 0x02, DATA2 - DATA2 PID. 0x03, MDATA - MDATA PID.

field.name: PKTSTS
field.description: Packet Status (host or device) - Value, Description 0x01, GOUTNAK - Device mode: Global OUT NAK (triggers an interrupt). 0x02, PKTRCV - Host mode: IN data packet received. Device mode: OUT data packet received. 0x03, XFERCOMPL - Host mode: IN transfer completed (triggers an interrupt). Device mode: OUT transfer completed (triggers an interrupt). 0x04, SETUPCOMPL - Device mode: SETUP transaction completed (triggers an interrupt). 0x05, TGLERR - Host mode: Data toggle error (triggers an interrupt). 0x06, SETUPRCV - Device mode: SETUP data packet received. 0x07, CHLT - Host mode: Channel halted (triggers an interrupt).

register.name: GRXSTSP
register.description: Receive Status Read and Pop Register

field.name: CHEPNUM

field.name: PKTSTS
field.description: Packet Status (host or device) - Value, Description 0x01, GOUTNAK - Device mode: Global OUT NAK (triggers an interrupt). 0x02, PKTRCV - Host mode: IN data packet received. Device mode: OUT data packet received. 0x03, XFERCOMPL - Host mode: IN transfer completed (triggers an interrupt). Device mode: OUT transfer completed (triggers an interrupt). 0x04, SETUPCOMPL - Device mode: SETUP transaction completed (triggers an interrupt). 0x05, TGLERR - Host mode: Data toggle error (triggers an interrupt). 0x06, SETUPRCV - Device mode: SETUP data packet received. 0x07, CHLT - Host mode: Channel halted (triggers an interrupt).

register.name: PCGCCTL
register.description: Power and Clock Gating Control Register

field.name: WARMTIME
field.description: Warm-Up Time - Value, Description 0x00, 4CYCLES - 4 HFPERCLK cycles 0x01, 8CYCLES - 8 HFPERCLK cycles 0x02, 16CYCLES - 16 HFPERCLK cycles 0x03, 32CYCLES - 32 HFPERCLK cycles 0x04, 64CYCLES - 64 HFPERCLK cycles 0x05, 128CYCLES - 128 HFPERCLK cycles 0x06, 256CYCLES - 256 HFPERCLK cycles 0x07, 512CYCLES - 512 HFPERCLK cycles

field.name: MODE
field.description: BURTC Enable - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - The BURTC is disabled. 0x01, EM2EN - The BURTC is in normal operating mode, operating in EM0-EM2. Oscillators must be enabled in CMU for use. 0x02, EM3EN - The BURTC is enabled in EM0-EM3. Will prevent CMU from disabling used oscillators all the way down to EM3. 0x03, EM4EN - The BURTC is enabled in EM0-EM4. Will prevent CMU from disabling used oscillators all the way down to EM4.

field.name: LPCOMP
field.description: Low power mode compare configuration - Value, Description 0x00, IGN0LSB - Do not ignore any bits for compare match evaluation. 0x01, IGN1LSB - The LSB of the counter is ignored for compare match evaluation. 0x02, IGN2LSB - The two LSBs of the counter are ignored for compare match evaluation. 0x03, IGN3LSB - The three LSBs of the counter are ignored for compare match evaluation. 0x04, IGN4LSB - The four LSBs of the counter are ignored for compare match evaluation. 0x05, IGN5LSB - The five LSBs of the counter are ignored for compare match evaluation. 0x06, IGN6LSB - The six LSBs of the counter are ignored for compare match evaluation. 0x07, IGN7LSB - The seven LSBs of the counter are ignored for compare match evaluation.

field.name: PRESC
field.description: Select BURTC prescaler factor - Value, Description 0x00, DIV1 - No prescaling. 0x01, DIV2 - Prescaling factor of 2 0x02, DIV4 - Prescaling factor of 4 0x03, DIV8 - Prescaling factor of 8 0x04, DIV16 - Prescaling factor of 16 0x05, DIV32 - Prescaling factor of 32 0x06, DIV64 - Prescaling factor of 64 0x07, DIV128 - Prescaling factor of 128

field.name: CLKSEL
field.description: Select BURTC clock source - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - No clock source selected for BURTC. 0x01, LFRCO - LFRCO selected as BURTC clock source. 0x02, LFXO - LFXO selected as BURTC clock source. 0x03, ULFRCO - ULFRCO selected as BURTC clock source.

field.name: LPMODE
field.description: Low power mode configuration. - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - Low power mode is disabled. 0x01, ENABLE - Low power mode always enabled. 0x02, BUEN - Low power mode enabled in backup mode.

field.name: OSC
field.description: LFXO failure detection configuration. - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - LFXO failure detection disabled. 0x01, LFRCO - LFRCO used for LFXO failure detection. 0x02, ULFRCO - ULFRCO used for LFXO failure detection.

field.name: BUMODETS
field.description: Timestamp for backup mode entry stored.

field.name: LOCKKEY
field.description: Configuration Lock Key - Value, Description 0x00, LOCK - 0x00, UNLOCKED - 0x01, LOCKED - 0x0AEE8, UNLOCK -

field.name: CLKSEL
field.description: Watchdog Clock Select - Value, Description 0x00, ULFRCO - ULFRCO 0x01, LFRCO - LFRCO 0x02, LFXO - LFXO

field.name: POWERDWN
field.description: ETM Control in low power mode

field.name: EXTINPNUM
field.description: Number of External Inputs - Value, Description 0x00, ZERO - Zero inputs presents 0x01, ONE - One inputs presents 0x02, TWO - Two inputs presents

field.name: TEICEWPNT
field.description: Trace Sart/Stop Block Uses EmbeddedICE watchpoint inputs

register.name: ETMITATBCTR2
register.description: ETM Integration Test ATB Control 2 Register

register.name: ETMITATBCTR0
register.description: ETM Integration Test ATB Control 0 Register

field.name: NONSECNONINVDBG
field.description: Non-secure non-invasive Debug Status - Value, Description 0x02, DISABLE - Non-secure non-invasive debug disable 0x03, ENABLE - Non-secure non-invasive debug enable
